p: The modulation effects of caraway on sexual function and fertility in females have been claimed in Egyptian folk medicine. 150 mg/kg oral caraway seed aqueous extract on fertility organ exposed to cadmium toxicity in rat animal model increased the serum estrogen in proestrus phase of cadmium treated rats. Atretic follicles and minor degenerative changes, stratified uterine epithelium and cystic endometrial gland with weakly reacted glands was observed in caraway treated rats, which exposed to cadmium. Caraway fruit aqueous extract showed antifertility effects, it significantly increased the estrogen level and reduced the progestrone and FSH levels at proestrus phase [ 56]. Caraway aqueous or ethanol extracts from doses higher than 200 mg/kg showed estrogenic effects. After 30 days administration of caraway extracts, changes in vaginal smear, was observed. The ovary weight, uterus weight and estrogen levels increased, while gonadotropins levels decreased [ 66].
